alert.note: Alert for Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 16 at 4:51PM EDT until June 16 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Stanly County in central North Carolina... * Until 800 PM EDT. * At 451 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Albemarle, Plyler, Locust, Badin, Oakboro, Stanfield, Richfield and New London. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
